snippet: Mayor de Blasio is looking for classroom space and qualified teachers to accommodate 50,000 prekindergartners. Charter schools are willing, but not allowed to provide prekindergarten.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio will need to align himself with city's charter schools, which he has cited for their 'destructive impact,' if he wants to accomplish his prekindergarten agenda; de Blasio is looking for classroom space and qualified teachers to accommodate 50,000 prekindergartners; charter schools are willing, but not permitted, to provide prekindergarten.
lead_paragraph: Mayor de Blasio is looking for classroom space and qualified teachers to accommodate 50,000 prekindergartners. Charter schools are willing, but not allowed to provide prekindergarten.

headline.main: De Blasio, a Critic of Charter Schools, May Need Them for His Pre-K Agenda
headline.print_headline: De Blasio, a Critic of Charter Schools, May Need Them for His Pre-K Agenda
